intro: Orophaca sericea, commonly known as silky orophaca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in moist, rocky soils. Orophaca sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable climates.
